summary: CAPTAIN MARVEL SPOILERS
body:
CAPTAIN MARVEL SPOILERS

Now that they are gone, has anyone else noticed Thor wasn’t in the end credits scene? We saw him in the compound in the first Endgame trailer? He was most likely so sad due to the decimation that he couldn’t even be around anyone else without feeling like a failure. This is why he smiled when he Saw Captain Marvel not flinch when he pulled out Storm Breaker. He now has hope for his mistake to be repaired.

This is why he smiled when he Saw Captain Marvel not flinch when he pulled out Storm Breaker. He now has hope for his mistake to be repaired.

summary: Anyone else sit at work, start thinking about Endgame and the possible character triumphs and deaths and all the angst, and have...
body:
Anyone else sit at work, start thinking about Endgame and the possible character triumphs and deaths and all the angst, and have to reign in emotion to keep from crying?

Cuz it just took me through a whole circle of emotions. Wow.

blog.name: doctorofmagic
blog.title: Doctor Strange's Daily Appreciation
blog.description: Dedicated to the hero of heroes.

tags: how can the sorcerer supreme be of assistance?
summary: Could you point me which comics Iron Man and Doctor Strange first met? Love your blog!
question: Could you point me which comics Iron Man and Doctor Strange first met? Love your blog!
answer:
Greetings and thanks for asking!

Aw, thank you, anon! I’m very glad you like this Sanctum!

Regarding your question… Well, the very first time Iron Man sought Doctor Strange, the Avengers had a bad first impression. Dormammu and Loki joined forces to deceive the Avengers and put them to fight the Defenders. As you know, the Sanctum has a magic defense and blasted the team away when they tried to knock on his door (by knocking I mean the Avengers style of kicking first and asking later). It happened in Avengers v1 #116.

As usual, everything ended well and they became allies. Tony acknowledges Stephen’s goodness and the good doctor decides to keep their memories intact, for the Defenders were a secret team, unknown to the world. 

Some issues later, though, Stephen teamed-up with Spider-man in Marvel Team-Up v1 #50-51, and Tony also helped them to solve a mystery and be part of a trial to judge the defendant. Tony calls him “Strange” instead of Doctor or Doctor Strange, which means, at least for me, that they’ve become friends from this moment on.

And that’s it! They teamed-up several times later, and also fought a couple ones, like every hero does! Hope my answer enlighted you.

Thank you for dropping an ask!

summary: Under the Weather
title: Under the Weather
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2JcOHEu

by lerums

Peter and Tony has both caught the cold. They deal. There’s no plot whatsoever. Cuddles, a bratty teenager and Steve coming home from a mission.

This is part of my superfamily series “Steve, Tony and their heir”, but can very well be read by itself!

blog.name: theironcan
blog.title: The Iron Can Man
blog.description: "Gods, aliens, other dimensions... I'm just a man in a can. "

summary:
Steve: we can't kill thanos. It's not possible
Tony: yes we can. Think of who you lost
Steve: you're right, I owe it to...
body:
Steve: we can’t kill thanos. It’s not possible

Tony: yes we can. Think of who you lost

Steve: you’re right, I owe it to Bucky

Tony: well actually now that I think about it. We just can’t kill thanos, it’s not possible.

reblog.comment:
Steve: we can’t kill thanos. It’s not possible

Tony: yes we can. Think of who you lost

Steve: you’re right, I owe it to Bucky

Tony: well actually now that I think about it. We just can’t kill thanos, it’s not possible.

Tony: yes we can. Think of who you lost

Steve: you’re right, I owe it to Bucky

Tony: well actually now that I think about it. We just can’t kill thanos, it’s not possible.

Tony: yes we can. Think of who you lost

Steve: you’re right, I owe it to Bucky

Tony: well actually now that I think about it. We just can’t kill thanos, it’s not possible.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: The Cold's Deceit
title: The Cold's Deceit
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Jhl1X3

by MercyMae

“I’m not worried about me,” Tony snapped, looking at the rear mirror. He saw Peter slumbering with his small mouth covering his mouth.

“I know you’re worried about Pete,” Pepper said slowly, and Tony gripped the wheel tightly. Of course he was worried about Peter. His kid was the most important thing in his life. He looked at the road in front of him. Snowflakes landed on his windshield with a small thump. So soft, yet so deadly.

Or…

They get stuck in a snowstorm.

Words: 3816, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

by MercyMae

“I’m not worried about me,” Tony snapped, looking at the rear mirror. He saw Peter slumbering with his small mouth covering his mouth.

“I know you’re worried about Pete,” Pepper said slowly, and Tony gripped the wheel tightly. Of course he was worried about Peter. His kid was the most important thing in his life. He looked at the road in front of him. Snowflakes landed on his windshield with a small thump. So soft, yet so deadly.

Or…

They get stuck in a snowstorm.

blog.name: thoseguysontheradio
blog.title: Hey guys...
blog.description:
This is Those Guys!
Those Guys on the Radio is the podcast division of TG Productions. They are based primarily out of New York City. They strive to bring you quality content, mostly consisting of reviews and discussions of professional wrestling, anime and manga, American comic books, video games, and television shows, both animated and live action.
TG Productions also has a let's play division called Those Guys Play, where they play video games from every platform! 
Like us on Facebook!
Those Guys on the Radio
Follow us on Twitter! 
Follow @ThoseGuysRadio
And like us on Instagram!

summary: TGOTR: Iron Man & The Incredible Hulk (2008) Review
title: TGOTR: Iron Man & The Incredible Hulk (2008) Review
body:
Hey, Those Guys on the Radio fans! Today, we’re doing another TG Throwback! This time, you can catch Matt and Anthony talking about Iron Man & The Incredible Hulk!


Here’s the link to listen in! http://tobtr.com/9007087


Here’s the YouTube link! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GXxOTayXpzs
